trans-unit.source: Adjust the way how Smart Blueberry handles door and window state changes.
You can turn off all your climate devices at once, if windows or doors are openend. You can activate this feature below.
Adjust the way how Smart Blueberry handles the irrigation of your garden.

In order to let Smart Blueberry handle all irrigation valves for you, name your valve items like <any name that contains "valve"> and configure your valve entity in respect to your irrigation conditions here.
In order to achieve an optimal irrigation, adjust the following values to your satisfaction.
Irrigation Level Per Minute (mm / in): Defines how much water will be irrigated by the valve upon your plants (1mm equals 1l/m¬≤, 1in equals 0.6234gal/ft¬≤)
Example 1: You have an area of 10m¬≤ and your valve pours 10l per minute. Consequently, you have an irrigation level of 1mm per minute (10l / 10m¬≤ = 1l/m¬≤ ‚âô 1mm).
Example 2: You have an area of 10ft¬≤ and your valve pours 0.6234gal per minute. Consequently, you have an irrigation level of 0.1in per minute (0.6234gal / 10ft¬≤ = 0.06234gal/ft¬≤ ‚âô 0.1in).
Evaporation Factor: Increase or decrease the evaporation per day that is based on the Hargreaves‚ÄìSamani model. Set it above 1 to increase evaporation, set it below 1 to decrease evaporation.
Minimal Temperature: Skips any irrigation triggers, if the temperature of the upcoming or last seven days has gone below the minimal temperature.
Bucket Size (days): Defines the range of days Smart Blueberry monitors the precipitation rate and decides to trigger irrigation.
Extend Bucket upon Future Rainfalls (days): Maximum number of days Smart Blueberry will postpone irrigation on upcoming rain, although precipitation level cannot be maintained.

Assuming no rain and an evaporation of 1mm / 1in a day, your plants need mm / in of water per day. Your valve irrigates per minute. Consequently the valve will irrigate for , if there was no rain for and will be no rain in .
An irrigation is planned for today.
You can trigger the _check_irrigation event in your Home Assistant automations that automatically start the irrigation check.
Additionally, any valve's state of <any name that contains "valve"> changed to off will trigger an irrigation check.
Optionally, you can activate the irrigation check on entity updates of <any name> entities.
Adjust the way how Smart Blueberry handles your lighting.
Lights are triggered automatically in dependence to daylight and presence changes.

Smart Blueberry will add manageable light modes in each area to let you adjust it's particular light configuration. Setup the lighting modes in each location by selecting your light configuration via light_mode_<your area_id> .
Your light configuration distinguishes between dark, obscured and bright conditions. For each condition you set the light behavior accordingly. Current choices are:

Light entities in areas with a lighting behavior of auto-on will turn off after a given time without presence events. Change the duration in your light configuration to adjust the number of minutes until lights are turned off automatically.

Smart Blueberry analyzes light measurement by incorporating all <any name that contains "illuminance"> and sun_solar_elevation entities to calculate the actual light condition. Adjust the tresholds of obscured and bright conditions below. light_condition is frequently updated and reflects the current light condition.
Note that all light measurement entities in areas with at least one active light entity are not put into consideration.
Adjust the way how Smart Blueberry reacts to presence changes.

The presence management will automatically adjust the presence state of n area and the entire home in dependence to the last presence detection events. In Smart Blueberry presence_mode reflects the presence status of your entire home and has three states:
In order to trigger presence, your presence entities should be names like <any name> and have the device_class attribute set to motion.
You can adjust the number of hours until presence management sets the presence state to away or abandoned by changing the values below.
Authenticate with your Home Assistant - Instance to get started with Smart Blueberry.
Please login into your Home Assistant to start the long-lived authentication flow with Home Assistant.
You successfully authenticated with Home Assistant. You are ready to read and modify the long-lived authentication status.
Set your user as the authenticating technical user for establishing API access. Smart Blueberry will request a long-lived token and use it to establish a long-lived connection to Home Assistant.
